content.en: Immunodeficiency algorithms: Algorithms play a crucial role in the diagnosis and classification of primary immunodeficiency (PID). They are used to develop efficient screening protocols for non-immunologists and suggest diagnostic trees for clinicians. Algorithms also aid in the standardization of flow cytometry techniques and can even provide personalized treatment and follow-up strategies for patients with common variable immunodeficiency (CVID). Additionally, algorithms are used to assess the diagnostic ability of certain tools, such as TREC and KREC, in diagnosing primary immunodeficiency.
content.da: Immunodeficiensalgoritmer: Algoritmer spiller en afgørende rolle i diagnosen og klassifikationen af primær immunodeficiens (PID). De bruges til at udvikle effektive screeningsprotokoller for ikke-immunologer og foreslå diagnostiske træer for klinikere. Algoritmer hjælper også med standardisering af flowcytometriteknikker og kan endda give personlige behandlings- og opfølgningsstrategier for patienter med common variable immunodeficiency (CVID). Derudover anvendes algoritmer til at vurdere de diagnostiske evner af visse værktøjer, såsom TREC og KREC, i diagnosen af primær immunodeficiens.
